## ‚úÖ Code Review Checklist

*The author should check these before submitting, and the reviewer should confirm during review.*

### General
- [ ] Code follows the established team naming conventions (camelCase for variables, PascalCase for components, etc.).
- [ ] Functionality has been verified locally and behaves as expected.
- [ ] The solution adheres to the problem statement and design specifications.

### Quality & Consistency
- [ ] Code builds successfully without errors.
- [ ] ESLint and Prettier checks pass (or are automatically fixed by the pre-commit hook).
- [ ] No extraneous `console.log` statements or debug code are left.

### Documentation & Maintenance
- [ ] New components/functions have meaningful JSDoc or inline comments where necessary.
- [ ] The README, documentation, or relevant configuration files have been updated if necessary.
- [ ] The PR is linked to the corresponding issue (`Fixes #123` or `Closes #456`).
